alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Kerr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:33PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bandera, southeastern Kerr and west central Kendall Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 632 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Comfort, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Comfort, Bandera, Center Point and Camp Verde. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
